def_cn: 含沙射影地说;旁敲侧击地指出;暗示
def_en: If you say that someone insinuates that something bad is the case, you mean that they say it in an indirect way.

def_cn: 使逐渐而巧妙地取得;使迂回潜入(或挤入)
def_en: If you say that someone insinuates themselves into a particular situation, you mean that they manage very cleverly, and perhaps dishonestly, to get into that situation.
